Tetrix Strategy Guide

Tetrix is a relaxing block puzzle game where you drag and drop colorful shapes onto a 10√ó10 grid. Clear complete rows and columns to score points, unlock shape rotation abilities, and keep the puzzle going. There's no time limit‚Äîtake your time, think strategically, and enjoy the satisfying gameplay!

Drag & Drop

At the bottom of the screen, you'll see your Shape Queue with three colorful shapes ready to use. To play, simply click and hold any shape to pick it up and start dragging. The shapes come in various Tetris-like configurations.

Key controls:

  • Click and hold on any shape to grab it
  • Drag the shape onto the 10x10 grid
  • Release to place the shape permanently
  • Valid placements appear bright; invalid ones appear faded

Clear Lines

The core mechanic of Tetrix is line clearing. When you completely fill any row (horizontal) or column (vertical) with blocks, that entire line disappears! This is how you prevent the grid from filling up and create space for more shapes.

Line clearing mechanics:

  • Complete rows: Fill all 10 blocks horizontally across any row to clear it
  • Complete columns: Fill all 10 blocks vertically down any column to clear it
  • Visual feedback: Watch lines highlight and disappear with satisfying animations

Combo Bonuses

Every time you clear lines, you earn points shown as animated blue gems. The more lines you clear simultaneously, the exponentially higher your score! Watch as an animated "gem shower" celebrates your achievement.

Scoring system:

  • Score formula: Points = (rows)¬≤ + (columns)¬≤ + (rows √ó columns √ó 2)
  • Combo multipliers: Clearing 2+ lines at once gives exponentially more points
  • Score display: Your score and gem count appear in the header

Rotate Shapes

Sometimes a shape doesn't quite fit the way you want it. That's where shape rotation comes in! You can spend gems to unlock the ability to rotate shapes, giving you more strategic options for fitting pieces into tight spaces.

Rotation system:

  • Unlock rotation: Click the üîÑ button on any shape to spend 1 gem and unlock rotation
  • Rotate: After unlocking, click ‚Üª or ‚Ü∫ to rotate 90¬∞
  • One-time cost: Pay once per shape, then rotate it as many times as you want

Game Over & New Game

If the grid fills up and none of your shapes can fit anywhere, it's game over‚Äîbut don't worry! You can always start fresh. The hamburger menu in the top-right corner gives you access to game controls and settings.

Tips for success:

  • Plan ahead and try to keep the grid balanced
  • Don't focus too much on one area‚Äîspread shapes across the grid
  • Save rotation gems for critical moments
  • Try to set up multi-line clears for maximum points
